title: 5-year-old boy recovering after shooting at park
content:
DEKALB COUNTY, Ga. - A five-year-old boy is recovering Monday morning after being shot in the head at a DeKalb County park. Police are calling the shooting accidental and said the boy's step-father pulled the trigger.
The shooting happened shortly before 1:30 p.m. Detectives think Jhakwan Williams, 24, accidentally grazed the boy with what turned out to be a pellet gun. A witness told police Williams tried to stop the boy's sister from playing with the gun.
@DeKalbCountyPD says 5 y/o boy shot in head at Lou Walker Park, person of interest in custody @FOX5Atlanta pic.twitter.com/fpazpbZF1W
— Marissa Mitchell (@MarissaMFOX5) September 11, 2016
The child is being treated at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta at Egleston. The boy's injuries are described as minor.
Jail records show Williams was charged with aggravated assault
